document.docAuthor: Dawah, Hassan A., Ahmad, Syed K., Abdullah, Mohammed A. & Zatwarnicki, Tadeusz
document.masterDocTitle: An overview of the Ephydridae (Diptera) of Saudi Arabia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An overview of the Ephydridae (Diptera) of Saudi Arabia

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Actocetor hendeli
de Meijere 1924: 202
[replacement name for
Actocetor beckeri Hendel 1917
, not de Meijere 1916]:
Dikow & Mathis 2002: 261
[synonymy].

Actocetor margaritatus panelii
Frey 1958: 46
:
Dikow & Mathis 2002: 261
[synonymy].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens examined.
2 ♀ , Asir , Abha , Madenate Al-Ameer Sultan , Hay Al-Sad ,
25. ii.–25. v. 2002
, Malaise trap , H.A. Dawah ( NMWC )
.

Distribution. Previously recorded from Saudi Arabia by Dabbour (1979a , b); Dabbour & El-Dawy (1981) , Dawah & Abdullah (2006) , by
El-Hawagry et al . (2016
& 2017 ) under two names: junior and senior synonyms and recently by
El-Hawagry et al . (2019)
. It was described from India and further recorded from: Afrotropical Region: Angola , Botswana , Cameroon , Cape Verde Islands, Democratic Republic of Congo , Eritrea , Ethiopia , Gambia , Ivory Coast , Kenya , Namibia , Nigeria , Oman , Rwanda , Senegal , Seychelles , Sierra Leone , Sokotra Island, South Africa , Tanzania , Uganda , Zimbabwe , Senegal , Sudan and United Arab Emirates ; Palaearctic Region: Canary Islands, Egypt , Israel , Spain ; Oriental Region: India , Malaysia , and Sri Lanka .
